about.heroSubtitle: Guam's premier martial arts tournament since 2007
about.p1: Since its inception in 2007, the Marianas Open has grown into one of the premier martial arts tournaments in the Pacific region. Hosted annually in Guam, this event has emerged as a symbol of excellence, uniting athletes, families, and supporters from around the world.
about.p2: The Marianas Open is more than just a competition—it's a celebration of community, culture, and the spirit of martial arts. Over the years, it has expanded into an international series, with tournaments held in Japan, the Philippines, Korea, and Guam, culminating in the grand finale on our home island. This event not only showcases the best in jiu-jitsu talent but also fosters a supportive environment for our youth and their families, promoting discipline, respect, and unity.
about.p3: Every year, the Marianas Open attracts participants of all ages and skill levels, from novice competitors to seasoned champions. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in the quality of competition and the sense of camaraderie that defines the event. In addition to the tournament this year, we will host an awards ceremony to honor our athletes' achievements and recognize the invaluable support of our sponsors.
about.p4: This event will be covered by international media and live-streamed by KUAM News, allowing people from around the world to tune in. With extensive coverage from international press, the Marianas Open connects with a global audience, giving attendees a chance to be part of an event that resonates deeply with our community values.
about.p5: Join us as we continue to build on this legacy, making each year's Marianas Open better than the last. Together, we can support the next generation of martial artists and strengthen the bonds that unite us.
about.timeline2007: The Marianas Open is founded in Guam as a local jiu-jitsu tournament.
about.timeline2015: The tournament expands with international competitors from Japan and the Philippines.
about.timeline2019: Pro Series launches with events across Asia—Japan, Philippines, Korea.
about.timeline2025: 1,300+ competitors from 6 countries. $2M economic impact to Guam.
about.timeline2026: International Pro Series spans 7 events across 6 countries.
about.contactDesc: Questions about the Marianas Open? Reach out to our team.

rankings.subtitle: ASJJF ranking points awarded at Marianas Open Pro Series events.
rankings.note: Points are awarded based on the star rating of each event. 'Alone' points are awarded when a competitor wins a division with no opponents. Team points follow the 4-Star scale for all events.
rankings.dynamicSubtitle: Live rankings calculated from official ASJJF event results across all Marianas Open tournaments.
rankings.formula: Points: Gold = 15 × event stars, Silver = 7 × stars, Bronze = 3 × stars

rankings.formulaNote: Based on ASJJF star-based ranking system. Per-match bonus points (+3 submission, +1 decision) not included.
